title: Memorandum of Understanding on implementation of Multisectoral Grant Assistance between India and Sri Lanka
decision_details: - It is proposed to sign a Framework Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of India and the Government of Sri Lanka to strengthen the socio economic development and bilateral cooperation. As per the said Framework Memorandum of Understanding, a series of development projects are planned to be implemented in the Eastern Province under the grant assistance of Rs.2,371.83 million provided by the Government of India. Under this, 33 projects related to infrastructure development and enhancement of livelihood have been identified for implementation, especially focusing on the sectors of education, health, agriculture, fisheries, tourism and community empowerment. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to sign the proposed Framework Memorandum of Understanding between the two parties, was approved by the Cabinet.
